My debut single "Vision of Love" became a massive hit, propelling me into stardom. Throughout the '90s, I released several successful albums such as "Emotions," "Music Box," and "Butterfly," each earning multiple awards, including Grammy Awards.

My distinctive voice and versatile musical style, blending elements of pop, R&B, and soul, have allowed me to remain relevant in the ever-changing music industry for over three decades. I've worked with legendary artists like Stevie Wonder, Whitney Houston, and Mariah's biggest rival, Beyoncé, showcasing my collaborative spirit.

Aside from my music career, I have also ventured into acting, with roles in films such as "Glitter," "Precious," and "The Star," and television shows like "All My Children" and "The Jordan Brand Campus Challenge." In 2014, I made a comeback with the hit song "Love You Like a Love Song" and continued to release music, including the acclaimed "Caution" album in 2018.

My personal life has also been in the public eye, with several high-profile relationships and a daughter, Morven, born in 1997. Despite the challenges, I remain a dedicated mother and continue to pursue my passions, proving that I am much more than a singer, songwriter, and actress – I am an inspiration to many.

As I celebrate my 50th birthday, I remain committed to pushing boundaries, staying true to my artistic vision, and making music that touches the hearts of millions.
